title: Commending Firefighter Edward S. Kicinski upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition after 35 years of dedicated service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Firefighter Edward S. Kicinski upon
the occasion of his designation for special recognition after  35  years
of dedicated service to the North Lindenhurst Fire Department

WHEREAS,  The firefighters of New York State are renowned throughout the
Nation; their reputation is synonymous with excellence  in  the  arduous
field of fire protection and prevention; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  the  early  days  of "teapot steamers," the volunteer
firefighter has been the cornerstone of our great  Nation's  efforts  to
spare us from the ravages of fire; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body is proud to commend Firefighter Edward
S. Kicinski upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
after 35 years of  dedicated  service  to  the  North  Lindenhurst  Fire
Department; and
  WHEREAS,  Edward S. Kicinski joined the North Lindenhurst Fire Depart-
ment in 1976, became a member of Hook, Ladder and Engine Company  No.  3
and is presently still a member of Company No. 3; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout his career Edward S. Kicinski had been diligent in
maintaining  his  professional training, always harboring a love for his
profession, and a profound work ethic; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Edward S. Kicinski is  a  proud  member  of  the
"HITMEN" softball team; and
  WHEREAS,  Edward  S.  Kicinski is certainly an asset to the department
and community and is always anxious to assist the North Lindenhurst Fire
Department in any way; and
  WHEREAS, Volunteer firefighters and fire departments not only  provide
the  critical service of fire protection but also engage in other activ-
ities of great benefit and importance to the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, It takes a special dedication, a strong desire to help others
and a tireless sense of community to forsake precious time  with  family
and  friends to respond to the signal that a neighbor is in need; Edward
S. Kicinski is such  a  firefighter;  throughout  35  years  of  devoted
service,  this volunteer heroically performed, above and beyond the call
of  duty,  those  responsibilities  which  define  the  task   of   fire
protection; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,    That  this Legislative Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Firefighter Edward S. Kicinski for  35  years  of  distinguished
service; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Edward S. Kicinski.
